verses.verse: Let me sing <WH7891> for my well beloved <WH3039> a song <WH7892> of my beloved <WH1730> about his vineyard. <WH3754> My beloved <WH3039> had a vineyard <WH3754> on a very fruitful <WH1121> hill. <WH7161>

He dug <WH5823> it up, <WH5619> gathered out its stones, planted <WH5193> it with the choicest vine, <WH8321> built <WH1129> a tower <WH4026> in its midst, <WH8432> and also cut <WH2672> out a winepress <WH3342> therein. <WH6960> He looked for it to yield <WH6213> grapes, <WH6025> but it yielded <WH6213> wild grapes. <WH891>
"Now, <WH3427> inhabitants of Jerusalem <WH3389> and men <WH376> of Judah, <WH3063> please judge <WH8199> between me and my vineyard. <WH3754>

What could have been done <WH6213> more to my vineyard, <WH3754> that I have not done <WH6213> in it? <WH4069> Why, when I looked <WH6960> for it to yield <WH6213> grapes, <WH6025> did it yield <WH6213> wild grapes? <WH891>

Now I will tell <WH3045> you what I will do <WH6213> to my vineyard. <WH3754> I will take away <WH5493> its hedge, <WH4881> and it will be eaten up. <WH1197> I will break down <WH6555> its wall <WH1447> of it, <WH4823> and it will be trampled down.

I will lay <WH7896> it a wasteland. <WH1326> It won't <WH2168> be pruned nor hoed, <WH5737> but it will grow <WH5927> briers <WH8068> and thorns. <WH7898> I will also command <WH6680> the clouds <WH5645> that they rain <WH4305> no rain on it. <WH4305>"

For the vineyard <WH3754> of Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies <WH6635> is the house <WH1004> of Israel, <WH3478> and the men <WH376> of Judah <WH3063> his pleasant <WH8191> plant: <WH5194> and he looked <WH6960> for justice, <WH4941> but, <WH4939> behold, oppression; for righteousness, <WH6666> but, <WH6818> behold, a cry of distress.

Woe <WH1945> to those who join <WH5060> house <WH1004> to house, <WH1004> who lay <WH7126> field <WH7704> to field, <WH7704> until there is no <WH657> room, <WH4725> and you are made to dwell <WH3427> alone in the midst <WH7130> of the land! <WH776>
In my ears, <WH241> Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies <WH6635> says: <WH3808> "Surely many <WH7227> houses <WH1004> will be desolate, <WH8047> even great <WH1419> and beautiful, <WH2896> unoccupied. <WH3427>
For <WH3588> ten <WH6235> acres <WH6776> of vineyard <WH3754> shall yield <WH6213> one <WH259> bath, <WH1324> and a homer <WH2563> of seed <WH2233> shall yield <WH6213> an ephah. <WH374>"

Woe <WH1945> to those who rise up early <WH7925> in the morning, <WH1242> that they may follow <WH7291> strong drink; <WH7941> who stay <WH309> late into the night, <WH5399> until wine <WH3196> inflames them! <WH1814>

The harp, <WH3658> lyre, <WH5035> tambourine, <WH8596> and flute, <WH5035> with wine, <WH3196> are at their feasts; <WH4960> but they don't <WH5027> respect the work <WH6467> of Yahweh, <WH3068> neither have they considered <WH7200> the operation <WH6467> of his hands. <WH3027>

Therefore my people <WH5971> go into captivity <WH1540> for lack of knowledge. <WH1847> Their honorable <WH3519> men <WH4962> are famished, <WH7458> and their multitudes <WH1995> are parched <WH6704> with thirst. <WH6772>

Therefore Sheol <WH7585> has enlarged <WH7337> its desire, <WH6310> and opened <WH6473> its mouth <WH6310> without measure; <WH2706> and their glory, <WH1926> their multitude, <WH1995> their pomp, <WH7588> and he who rejoices <WH5938> among them, <WH3381> descend into it.
So man <WH120> is brought low, <WH7817> mankind <WH120> is humbled, <WH8213> and the eyes <WH5869> of the arrogant <WH1364> ones are humbled; <WH8213>
but Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies <WH6635> is exalted <WH1361> in justice, <WH4941> and God <WH410> the Holy <WH6918> One is sanctified <WH6942> in righteousness. <WH6666>
Then the lambs <WH3532> will graze <WH7462> as in their pasture, <WH1699> and strangers <WH1481> will eat <WH398> the ruins <WH2723> of the rich. <WH4220>
Woe <WH1945> to those who draw <WH4900> iniquity <WH5771> with cords <WH2256> of falsehood, <WH7723> and wickedness <WH2403> as with cart <WH5699> rope; <WH5688>

Who say, <WH559> "Let him make speed, <WH4116> let him hasten <WH2363> his work, <WH4639> that we may see <WH7200> it; <WH6098> and let the counsel of the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478> draw near <WH7126> and come, <WH935> that we may know it! <WH3045>"

Woe <WH1945> to those who call <WH559> evil <WH7451> good, <WH2896> and good <WH2896> evil; <WH7451> who put <WH7760> darkness <WH2822> for light, <WH216> and light <WH216> for darkness; <WH2822> who put <WH7760> bitter <WH4751> for sweet, <WH4966> and sweet <WH4966> for bitter! <WH4751>
Woe <WH1945> to those who are wise <WH2450> in their own eyes, <WH5869> and prudent <WH995> in their own sight! <WH6440>
Woe <WH1945> to those who are mighty <WH1368> to drink <WH8354> wine, <WH3196> and <WH582> champions <WH2428> at mixing <WH4537> strong drink; <WH7941>
who acquit <WH6663> the guilty <WH7563> for <WH6118> a bribe, <WH7810> but deny <WH5493> justice <WH6666> for the innocent! <WH6662>

Therefore as the tongue of fire <WH784> devours <WH398> the stubble, <WH7179> and as the dry grass <WH2842> sinks down <WH7503> in the flame, <WH3956> so their root <WH8328> shall be as rottenness, <WH4716> and their blossom <WH6525> shall go up <WH5927> as dust; <WH80> because they have rejected <WH3988> the law <WH8451> of Yahweh <WH3068> of Armies, <WH6635> and despised <WH5006> the word <WH565> of the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel. <WH3478>

Therefore Yahweh <WH3068>'s anger <WH639> burns <WH2734> against his people, <WH5971> and he has stretched out <WH5186> his hand <WH3027> against them, <WH5221> and has struck them. <WH2022> The mountains tremble, <WH7264> and their dead bodies <WH5038> are as refuse <WH5478> in the midst <WH7130> of the streets. <WH2351> For all this, <WH639> his anger is not turned away, <WH7725> but his hand <WH3027> is still stretched out. <WH5186>

He will lift up <WH5375> a banner <WH5251> to the nations <WH1471> from far, <WH7350> and he will whistle <WH8319> for them from the end <WH7097> of the earth. <WH776> Behold, <WH935> they will come speedily <WH4120> and swiftly. <WH7031>

None shall be weary <WH5889> nor stumble <WH3782> among them; <WH5123> none shall slumber nor sleep; <WH3462> neither shall the belt <WH232> of their waist <WH2504> be untied, <WH6605> nor the latchet <WH8288> of their shoes <WH5275> be broken: <WH5423>

whose arrows <WH2671> are sharp, <WH8150> and all their bows <WH7198> bent. <WH1869> Their horses <WH5483>' hoofs <WH6541> will be like <WH2803> flint, <WH6862> and their wheels <WH1534> like a whirlwind. <WH5492>

Their roaring <WH7581> will be like a lioness. <WH3833> They will roar <WH7580> like young lions. <WH3715> Yes, <WH5098> they shall roar, and seize <WH270> their prey <WH2964> and carry it off, <WH6403> and there will be no one to deliver. <WH5337>

They will roar <WH5098> against them in that day <WH3117> like the roaring <WH5100> of the sea. <WH3220> If one looks <WH5027> to the land <WH776> behold, <WH2822> darkness and distress. <WH6862> The light <WH216> is darkened <WH2821> in its clouds. <WH6183>
